name: RI_1_1_15_1_Evidence_of_Record_Entry_Restore_Event
title: RI.1.1.15.1 Evidence of Record Entry Restore Event (Function)
description: Maintain Evidence of Record Entry Restore Event
purpose: Evidence of Record Entry Restore Event includes key metadata, ensures health record integrity (and trust) and enables record audit.

statement.label: RI.1.1.15.1#01
statement.requirement: The system SHALL audit each occurrence when archived Record Entry content is restored.

statement.label: RI.1.1.15.1#02
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the organization where Record Entry content is restored.

statement.label: RI.1.1.15.1#03
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the patient who is subject of restored Record Entry content.

statement.label: RI.1.1.15.1#04
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture an archive identifier for restored Record Entry content (e.g., nursing home inpatient stay from 3/15/2000 thru 6/10/2000).

statement.label: RI.1.1.15.1#05
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the user restoring Record Entry content.

statement.label: RI.1.1.15.1#06
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the system application which restored Record Entry content.

statement.label: RI.1.1.15.1#07
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture the type of Record Event trigger (i.e., restore).

statement.label: RI.1.1.15.1#08
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture the date and time Record Entry content is restored.

statement.label: RI.1.1.15.1#09
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD capture identity of the location (i.e., network address) from which Record Entry content is restored.

statement.label: RI.1.1.15.1#10
statement.requirement: The system MAY capture the rationale for restoring Record Entry content.

statement.label: RI.1.1.15.1#11
statement.requirement: The system MAY capture the data, document or other identifier for restored Record Entry content.
